description:
LES Ã‰COUTEURS
electronics, programming

On the other side of the world,
someone has the same headphones
as us, and you can hear in their living room.
On the one hand, we are listened to,
we know it, and on the other hand we listen.
In the idea of looking through a keyhole,
or as a window into the life of a stranger.
Les Ã©couteurs are designed to ask us
about our relationship to privacy.
Its use also provides an opportunity
to escape from our daily lives.

THE SOUND OF THE LINK
electronics, programming

Inspired by the short story The Camille Stories
written by Donna Haraway,
I conceived my project in relation
to a utopian future
in which groups of people
organize themselves into microsociety.
The installation The Sound of the Links
is a fragment of this civilization
that tells how humans
experiment communication with plants
in an attempt to rebuild a way of life
in symbiosis with the species that surround them.
I wanted to raise awareness about
these imperceptible phenomena
recently discovered by biologists,
so that we could imagine
a different relationship to the world
than that of exploitation.

ORIGAMY CLOCK
creative coding

A visual, poetic representation
of time that elapses in a day.
One minute, a triangle is formed,
one hour an aglomerate.
The organic forms wander
all day long in the space.
23h59 the space is saturated with forms,
at midnight, everything is empty
to start from scratch.

LANDSCAPE
collaboration with Clara Aboulker
and Romain Roucoules
3D videoÂ 

Exploration of the types
of 3D transformations on a photo.
Three videos that have the same starting
landscape are transformed
into different atmospheres,
water, mountains and forest.
The still image comes to life,
to return to its initial point.

INTERNET TAPIS VOLANT
bachelor thesis

I decided to question what the Internet was.
I focused my research on the creation
of the Internet, and the utopias it has created.
I wonder what this generates in terms
of objects and spaces in our lives
in a more contemporary context.
Then, I analyzed in a more metaphorical way.
I introducing the notion of heterotopia,
the central point of comparison in my thesis,
Finally, I wondered about Man's approach
to wanting to create technologies
that go beyond himself in order to improve
and/or emancipate, when he often seems
to be overtaken by his own limitations.
My thesis took the form of a carpet in reference
to the flying carpet mentioned by Michel Foucault.Â

APP COLLECTION
electronics

I can't open my phone
and see all the apps Iâ€™m using !
I consume them, knowing little
about how they work.
Their free and instantaneous nature
are not satisfactory.
So what's inside the box?
I decide to give a materiality
to some functions of my phone
- the lamp, the mp3, the compass -
to make hardware what was sofware,
in the format of my smartphone,
and not the form of their old object identity.

FREE$PEECH
with Alfatih Al Zouabi and Sani Irsay
object connected, electronic, programming

Free $peech, are two phones
that allow to translate conversations
from one language to another.
However, everything that is said
is directly twitt. You then have
the choice: introduce a piece
for a confidential sentence.
We have thought about the notions
of privacy on the web, and data collection.
What control do we have over
our information when more and more
services are claimed free ?

MATIÃˆRE LUMIÃˆRE
stenope technique

Experiments with different
exposure times to achieve
an abstraction of light.

PICTURE SPACE
programming exercise in three.js

cutting an image
applied to moving shapes.
The 3D space allows you
to move through the space
with the mouse or the gyroscope
of the phone.

KADAVRESKY
3D video, virtual reality
music, Eliya

I have made people
around me exquisite corpses.
2D drawings are transformed
into 3D sculptures. Virtual reality
allows them to be visualized
sin a three-dimensional space.
Their scales, their movements
take on a new dimension.
I created an unreal and immersive space.
An infinite place, suspended in the air,
a virtual gallery whose properties
are possible with this type
of visualization

GLADIS
electronics, programming

Gladis is an artificial intelligence.
She proposes to record voice
messages and lock them with a photo
that you take in the moment.
A city voice mailbox that allows
you to imagine another communication
between friends.

MY PERSONAL PICTURES
Programming exercise

What does my computer understand about my photos?
He will analyze a group of pixels, so we can
read my picture through the words he has defined.
The final image is visible after a number of clicks.

RAW MUSIC
UX / UI

Raw music is an application
connected to an audio recorder.
The object is a small button
to keep on yourself, to reach.
It allows you to record a sound
quickly by pressing and holding.
The sound synchronizes with the application.
On the app interface, we find sorted
the sounds we have captured.
This makes a sound library
that can be used as a memo.
